key_points: A social media claim about a fourth stimulus payment of $2,000 per person by Memorial Day weekend is false.
Congress has not approved a fourth round of direct stimulus payments as part of COVID-19 relief.
Three rounds of stimulus payments have been authorized since the start of the COVID-19 pandemic.
The IRS is still distributing the third round of payments, which includes up to $1,400 per person.
Misinformation circulates regarding a fourth round of stimulus payments and incorrect child tax credit amounts.
The child tax credit for 2021 will provide $250 to $300 per child between July and December, not $300 to $500 as claimed.
More than 50 House members and 21 senators have expressed support for recurring stimulus payments, but no action has been taken.
White House press secretary Jen Psaki stated that the discussion about a fourth round of payments is up to Congress.
So far, 164 million payments totaling $386 billion have been sent in the third-round stimulus.
The claim of a fourth $2,000 stimulus payment by Memorial Day is false; Congress only approved three rounds.
